intro: Crawfurdia japonica var. luteoviridis, commonly known as the Japanese yellow crawfurdia, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-green leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar ecological roles.
